controllers

Class CRUDPersonnage

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.CRUDPersonnage

  • public class CRUDPersonnage
extends Object
    Manages a game' personnages and their different derivations (soldier, chef) but while ensuring they are create from the correct current universe's associated sub-class. This class only contains CRUD method. Creation, retrieval, deletion of chefs, and soldiers (no update methods supported).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int nextID
      The next identifier to assign to any newly created character.
      private static HashMap<Integer,Personnage> personnages
      The managed and known game' current characters, this dictionary assigns as key-pair values: {characterId => character}.

      CRUDPersonnage()

    • Method Detail

      • creerChef

        public static Chef creerChef(String nom,
                             String qualificatif,
                             int force)
        Creates a new managed chef in the currently set game's universe.
        Parameters:
        nom - The chef' names.
        qualificatif - The chef's full name prefix.
        force - The chef's force (if any).
        Returns:
        The created chef.

      • creerSoldat

        public static Soldat creerSoldat(String nom,
                                 int force)
        Creates a new managed soldier in the currently set game's universe.
        Parameters:
        nom - The soldier' names.
        force - The soldier's force (if any).
        Returns:
        The created soldier.

      • get

        public static Personnage get(int id)
                      throws PersonneInexistanteException
        Retrieves a given character from a given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - The character's identifier.
        Returns:
        The found character.
        Throws:
        PersonneInexistanteException - Thrown whenever a non-existing character identifier was passed (e.g.: deleted character).

      • getPersonnages

        public static Collection<Personnage> getPersonnages()
        Retrieves the list of managed characters.
        Returns:
        The character list;

      • supprimer

        public static String supprimer(Personnage personnage)
                        throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Cleanly deletes a given character. Invoking Personnage.seFaireSupprimer().
        Parameters:
        personnage - The character to delete.
        Returns:
        The deletion message, if any.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if the user is attempting to delete a character that is still alive.

      • tuerEtToutSupprimer

        public static void tuerEtToutSupprimer()
        Kills every existing (managed) characters, and then, deletes them. This allows to clean up the battle field upon God's order.
